availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas M. Webb (Bourbon County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married Mary C. Daugherty in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on February 10, 1857. Father to Charles Webb and Thomas Webb. Clerk in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Merchant in Bourbon County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860. Grocer in Bourbon County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Sharpsburg, p. 104B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, p. 140A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Bourbon County, KY, July 1863, p. 27.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film 000183145.
"Thomas M. Webb (1833-1865)," Find A Grave, Memorial 126928247, accessed August 25, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/126928247.
